summary: The NES is a classic video game console made by Nintendo. It started as the Famicom in Japan in 1983 and later launched in the US in 1985. The NES was a popular 8-bit console with games like Super Mario Bros. and The Legend of Zelda. It helped save the video game industry after a big crash. The NES was easy to use and had a unique design, selling over 60 million units worldwide. It was replaced by the Super Nintendo in 1990.
title: Nintendo Entertainment System
